A 45-year-old woman presents to the OPD with complaints of tiredness. On general Examination, she is found to have facial puffiness, pedal edema & her nails appear as follows. What is the most likely diagnosis?
During your rounds in the neonatal ward, you see a 2week old neonate with the following skin finding. It is a disorder of which of the following glands?
As a first-year derma resident, you see a patient with the following findings. What nail changes are characteristic for this skin disease?
Direct ImmunoFluorescence of a patient's skin Biopsy reveals intraepidermal intercellular deposition of IgA. What would be the most likely Diagnosis?
A 28-year-old lady has asymptomatic dome-shaped small lesions on forehead for last 2 months. She has a 2-year- old daughter with similar lesions. What is the causative agent of the lesion?
A diabetic male red, tender & painful swelling on right buttock with multiple discharging points. Swelling is hard and indurated. There is high grade fever with malaise. Most likely diagnosis is?

options.label: D
options.text: Trigged by use of some drugs

questions.correct_answer: D. Trigged by use of some drugs

questions.text: A patient presents with asymptomatic, gradually expanding, infiltrated plaque with central scarring as shown in image. Likely diagnosis is?
Which of the following is a primary skin lesion?
A child presents with easily pluckable hair, scarring alopecia with boggy swelling of scalp. All used in treatment of this condition except?

A factory worker comes to you with itchy, annular scaly plaques in the groin. On prescribing corticosteroid ointment, there is significant relief in pruritus, but the lesion continues to extend peripherally. What is the likely diagnosis?
A sexually active male presented with warts on his penis as shown below. Which of these strains of HPV is most commonly the cause of these lesions?
A young female presented with vaginal itching and green frothy genital discharge. Strawberry vagina is seen on examination. What will be the drug of choice?
A 13-year-old boy presents with itchy lesions on his arm as shown. His family history is positive for asthma. What could be the most probable diagnosis?
Vitiligo is commonly associated with?
A 23-year-old male complains of recurrent scaly lesions on glans penis. It always occurred at the same site and healed with slight hyperpigmentation. What is the most likely diagnosis?
40 years old diabetic patients with round lesions for 2 weeks on abdomen. HPE shows palisading granuloma. What is the diagnosis?

A man presents with rashes on face and also complains of decreased mental function. He is also having few macular lesions on his skin. On CT scan, intracranial calcification was seen. His wife is normal. His 10-year-old daughter is also normal but his 6-year-old son is also having similar skin lesions. What would be the most likely diagnosis?
Cutis marmorata occurs due to exposure to?
Assertion : Darier’s sign is seen in darier’s disease Reason : Scratching the lesions of darier’s disease lead to mast cell degranulation

options.label: A

questions.explanation: Ans. D. If both A and R are wrong

Match the following diseases & their characteristic woods lamp findings:

A male patient has sought medical attention due to noticeable hair loss over scalp. Upon examination, you observe that the hair loss is diffuse in nature, affecting both the crown and frontal scalp regions. Interestingly, despite this diffuse hair loss, the hairline at the front remains remarkably well-maintained. What is the pattern of hair loss described in this case scenario?

A 50-year-old woman presented with the following condition of toe nails. The discolouration spread proximally as a streak in the nail & later the entire nail was affected. Gradually the entire nail became brittle & separated from the nail bed. Most likely cause?
A pt with nodulocystic acne has been on oral retinoids for 3 months. Which of the following parameter is to be monitored during retinoid therapy?
A patient was treated with steroids for psoriasis. On stopping the treatment, he develops fever, malaise, and lesion as seen in the image below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A pt presents with the following itchy lesions. O/E, Nikolsky sign is negative. Autoantibodies against which of the following antigens are most commonly seen in this condition?
A 36-year-old woman presents with the following Hypo aesthetic skin lesions. Which of the following type of disease is this lesion characteristic of?

During the course of her treatment for leprosy, a woman develops painful lesions over previous lesional sites that resolve with usage of Steroids. Which of the following statement is incorrect about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is seen in borderline spectrum of disease

options.label: B
options.text: Systemic symptoms are not a feature

options.label: D
options.text: It presents with new red painful lesions

questions.correct_answer: D. It presents with new red painful lesions
questions.explanation: Ans. D. It presents with new red painful lesions

options.label: C

Consider the following in respect of Salmon patch: It is a haemangioma. Its usual site is nape of neck. It is common in children. It needs surgical excision. Which of the statements given above are correct?

questions.correct_answer: A. Benzathine penicillin 7.2 million units in three divided doses
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Benzathine penicillin 7.2 million units in three divided doses

questions.text: Young male 24 years age with asymptomatic scaly lesions over body. Images of Christmas tree pattern and collarette scaling given. Diagnosis?
The most common triggering factor of the given condition is:
What long-term complication is most likely to occur in this patient having this lesion since birth?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Malignant melanoma

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Giant congenital melanocytic
  • • 2-5% risk
  • • Risk factors for Malignant Melanoma (MM) are as follows:
  • • Risk factors for Malignant Melanoma
  • • ﻿﻿ Family history ﻿﻿ Melanocytic nevus - may be congenital nevus ( >20 cm – Giant congenital melanocytic nevus has 2-5% risk of melanoma) or atypical/dysplastic nevus ﻿﻿Genetic mutations- mutations of CDKN2A gene (major susceptibility), MC1R gene (moderate susceptibility), TYR gene (low susceptibility) ﻿﻿Fitzpatrick's Skin type I has two-fold increased risk as compared to type IV. ﻿﻿ Sun exposure
  • • ﻿﻿ Family history
  • • Family
  • • ﻿﻿ Melanocytic nevus - may be congenital nevus ( >20 cm – Giant congenital melanocytic nevus has 2-5% risk of melanoma)

  • • ﻿﻿Genetic mutations- mutations of CDKN2A gene (major susceptibility), MC1R gene (moderate susceptibility), TYR gene (low susceptibility)
  • • CDKN2A gene

  • • TYR gene
  • • ﻿﻿Fitzpatrick's Skin type I has two-fold increased risk as compared to type IV.
